text.title: Top 10 Places To Visit in Sicily - Travel Guide
text.p: what's up guys my name is ryan and i
recently returned from exploring sicily
and i want to share with you my favorite
places so here's my sicily top 10.
[Music]
sicily is the largest island in the
mediterranean it's located off the toe
of italy's boot and it's home to three
active volcanoes and some of the most
impressive archaeological sites from the
stunning aeolian islands into the
seaside views of scopeello sicily has so
many incredible places to visit let's
start this video off at cefalu now
locate about an hour's drive from
palermo this may be one of my favorite
places in sicily we spent several days
here and i just really enjoyed it
cheffalu was first mentioned back in 396
bc and today it's one of sicily's most
well-known towns one of my favorite
things about chevalu was its sunsets the
light hits the town perfectly giving it
this orange glow i love just chilling on
the beach admiring the town's
architecture now another spot i really
liked in the town was the marina you
could walk around the back side and
there's plenty of spots to relax and
just watch the sunset i mean walking
back through the town's alleyways made
me feel like i was walking into italy
from a different era i mean i couldn't
recommend cefalu enough afterwards we're
going to visit scopeello now look at
about an hour's drive from palermo the
main reason i wanted to go here was to
visit the farglioni di scopeello there
are these very unique sea stacks that
remind me of a mini version of the fire
galoni in capri now the spot is one of
the oldest tuna fishing places dating
back to the 15th century and it recently
gained popularity after being featured
in the movie ocean's 12. there's a great
beach at the bottom you can pay to enter
and there's some excellent snorkeling in
the crystal clear waters around the
rocks hard to beat these sea views now
afterwards we're going to visit san vito
lo capo now locate about 50 minute drive
from skopelo san vito lo capo is this
beautiful seaside town with one of the
most famous beaches in all of sicily one
of my favorite features of the area is
the mountain called monte monaco that
overlooks the town now while we're there
we walked around the town and checked
out the beach i mean it really was a
nice place afterwards we're going to
visit taromina located on the eastern
side of sicily germany is this
incredible hilltop town full of italian
charm and history the town was founded
around ancient greek times and has been
a popular european getaway since the
19th century i just had a great time
walking around the alleyways and streets
of the town i really liked the main
piazza it had this really beautiful
white and checkered pattern and you can
also see mount aetna from there now the
main attraction in termina is the
ancient greco-roman theater it was built
around the 3rd century bc and was
rebuilt by the romans today it holds
events and also hosted the g7 summit
back in 2017. one of the main reasons i
wanted to visit teramina was to visit
the zola bella now also called the pearl
of the ionian sea the sola bella is this
beautiful island located right below
terramina you can get there by taking a
gondola from the town if you don't want
to make the hike now once you get down
to the bay you'll find a nice beach
perfect for some mediterranean
sunbathing i mean i just had a good time
just walking around and checking out the
area now afterwards we're going to head
up to mount aetna now with a height of
3357 meters mount etna is the highest
active volcano in all europe it's also
one of the most active volcanoes in the
world now when we were there we drove as
high as we could on the volcano from
there you can take up a gondola and then
you can ride up on these special cars
even higher i'm so mad at myself because
we got there right around 4 30 and
that's when the lift closed instead we
decided to hike around some of the
craters right by the parking lot and
it's just hard to comprehend how massive
this volcano is there's volcanic rock
that continues down the mountain i mean
you get these insane views from up there
i'm just such an incredible spot i just
wish i had more time to go check out the
top now at the base of mount etna is the
city of catania now katana is the second
largest city on the island i just love
the views of mount itana you can get
from catania now it just shows how
massive the volcano really is now
afterwards we're gonna visit syracuse
now this may be one of the most historic
cities in all of sicily syracuse was
founded by ancient greek corinthians
over 2
700 years ago and was described by
cicero as the greatest greek city and
the most beautiful of them all it was
part of the roman republic and also was
the capital of the byzantine empire for
a few years the apostle paul also spent
some time here today you can see many
ancient ruins such as the greek theater
an interesting feature of syracuse is
the castello mariante it was completed
in the year 1240 in such unique shape as
it extends into the sea now one of the
most impressive places on sicily is the
valley of the temples located in the
town of agrigento this is one of the
world's most stunning examples of greek
architecture now there were seven
temples built here by the greeks in the
5th century bc they were sadly burnt
down by the carthaginians but rebuilt by
the romans four centuries later one of
the most well preserved is the temple of
concordia it features the classic greek
pillars it just makes you wonder what
they must have looked like when it was
first built another fascinating nearby
attraction is the stare of the turks now
it's likely just 20 minutes from the
valley of the temples now the stare of
the turks or turkish steps are these
white limestone cliffs with an
impressive beach according to ancient
legends turkish pirates would climb up
these steps to loot the nearby villages
now another nearby place in the area is
punta bianca as the same rock formations
as the turkish steps and also has an
abandoned building i mean such a cool
spot now afterwards we're going to visit
the capital city of sicily palermo now
located on the northwest coast of the
island it's the largest city in the
country and was founded all the way back
in 734 bc by the phoenicians if you find
a sicily i recommend coming to this
airport wouldn't do too much in palermo
but it is an impressive city with some
incredible churches and amazing places
nearby now afterwards we're going to
head off the mainland of sicily to visit
the island of lampedusa now located
right in between malta and tunisia this
italian island is full of mediterranean
views and crystal clear waters it's the
southernmost place in all italy now to
get there you can take a ferry from
sicily or also take a plane now the
island's rapids beach has been voted as
one of the world's best and definitely
the island we're visiting now for our
final destination we're going to visit
the yolian islands now the aeolian
islands are an archipelago made up of
seven inhabited islands located off of
sicily's northern coast now the islands
were created by volcanic activity and as
a result they are home to some of the
most bizarre landscapes now to get to
the yelling islands there are several
ways to go about it you can take a ferry
from the town of milazzo or you can
experience them by a sailboat now we
went with dreams horizon yachting we
were on one of their catamarans and it
was just an unbelievable experience we
saw it around for a week and went to
some of the most phenomenal places the
islands have to offer now the most epic
island on the archipelago is probably
stromboli it's nicknamed the lighthouse
of the mediterranean and at night you
can see lava shooting out the top we
took a boat to the northern side of the
island and got some of the best views of
the volcano there's this massive slope
covered in volcanic rocks and ash i mean
just such a phenomenal place now another
one of my favorite islands was panarea
it's the smallest of the aeolian islands
but has so much charm i loved all the
whitewashed houses it reminded me of a
greek island there was also these huge
sea cliffs imagine couldn't believe how
huge they were and there was also these
little islands off of panarea that had
these volcanic sea bubbles we went
snorkeled in and explored i just love
the yuolin islands so freaking much and
couldn't recommend them enough well that
is it for my sicily top ten i'm barely
scratching the surface i mean you could
spend months exploring sicily there's
just so much to see let me know where
your favorite place is in sicily in the
comments below i also have a relaxation
channel where you make hour-long films
to bring some peace and nature in your
life i did a film on the mediterranean
with a lot of shots from sicily that i
think you'll enjoy you can find me on
instagram
shirley.films it's ryan and we will see
you later
[Music]
[Applause]
bye
[Music]
